title: 100th Derivative
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/solvable/5feecf2915.135fab9ca3.Oi5EVJ.png?width=250"}},{"type":"text","text":"\nEvaluate the 100th derivate of the given function at x=0."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let,    "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"y = f(x) = 4x^{3} - 8\cos x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let      "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"y_n "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"       be the         "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n_{th}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"       derivative. "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"It is clear that.      "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"100_{th}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"        derivative of.        "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4x^{3}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"      will be zero. "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"-8\cos x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"       follows a pattern in its derivatives.     "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"8\sin x , 8\cos x , -8\sin x , -8\cos x , ........"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"                   After every 4 derivatives it repaeats."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac {100}{4} = 25"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"          .Hence,  after 25 cycles its repeats to the same, i.e,      "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"y_{100} = -8\cos x = -8"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"                        .Since,         "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x = 0."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"ANSWER :\boxed{-8}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

"},{"type":"heading","attrs":[{"level":6}],"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Check out the set: 2016 Problems."}]}]}

title: 100 upvotes!
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \large \int _{ 0 }^{ 1 }{ \dfrac {(\text{Li}_2(x) )^2 }{ { x }^{ 2 } } \, dx }=h\zeta (u)-n\zeta (d)-\dfrac { r }{ e } \zeta (d_1) "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If the equation above holds true for positive integers "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"h,u,n,d,r,e"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d_1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"r"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"e"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are coprime, find "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"h+u+n+d+r+e+d_1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Notations","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":":"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"bulletList","content":[{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\zeta(\cdot) "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" denotes the "},{"type":"text","text":"Riemann zeta function","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]},{"type":"text","text":"."}]}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{ \text{Li} }_{ n }(a) "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" denotes the "},{"type":"text","text":"polylogarithm","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]},{"type":"text","text":" function, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{ \text{Li} }_{ n }(a)=\displaystyle\sum _{ k=1 }^{ \infty  }{ \dfrac { { a }^{ k } }{ { k }^{ n } }  } "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]}]}]}]}

body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"How many 2 digit numbers are there, such that the tens digit is smaller than the units digit?"}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We can solve this question by taking cases."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"First case in which 9  is in the unit's place then 8 number can be placed in one's place."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Similarly when  8 is there in unit place then 7 digits can be placed in ten's place . This series will go till there is 2 in unit place and only 1 can take ten's place."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So total number of numbers are 1+2+3+4………+8 = 36"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

replies.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            It turns out to be such a nice simple sum.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

comments.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Exactly how I did it, but to sum 1-8 quickly just do (n"},{"type":"text","text":"(n+1))/2 or 8","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]},{"type":"text","text":"*9/2

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A combinatorics-less solution,"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1x -> the tens digit is 1, therefore there are 8 solutions (1 < 2, 3, ..., 9),
2x -> the tens digit is 2, therefore there are 7 solutions (1 < 2 < 3, 4, ..., 9)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"8 + 7 + 6 + 5 + 4 + 3 + 2 + 1 = 36"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Since the tenth digit is smaller than the unit digit, we are left with {1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,9} to pick for either tenth or unit place of the digit. 
If we have to choose two digits out of those 9 digits  and order them in strictly descending order, "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We can do that in"},{"type":"text","text":"* 9C2 ways","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]},{"type":"text","text":"* = (9*8)/2 = "},{"type":"text","text":"36 ways","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Alternatively, you can count by each combination:","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":"
To make sure the number is bigger then the tenth digit: "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"when the tenth digit is 1, you can pick the unit digit in 8C1 ways (from: 2,3,4,5,6,7,8,9)  =  "},{"type":"text","text":"8 ways","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"when the tenth digit 2, you can pick the unit digit in 7C1 ways (from: 3,4,5,6,7,8,9) = "},{"type":"text","text":"7 ways","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"when the tenth digit 3, you can pick the unit digit in 6C1 ways = "},{"type":"text","text":"6 ways","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"..."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"... "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"when the tenth digit is 8, you can pick the unit digit only in "},{"type":"text","text":"1 way","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":". i.e.: 89"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"so, the "},{"type":"text","text":"total no. of digits","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" you can form where the tenth digit is smaller than the unit digit is: "},{"type":"text","text":"8+ 7+ 6 + 5+ 4+ 3+ 2+ 1 = (8*9)/2 = 36","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We can be sure that for every ten numbers (starting 10), the count of the numbers with the tens being higher or equal to the ones place is: 1 plus the tens number itself (e.g. for range 10 - 19, that would be 10 and 11, for range 20-29, that would be 20 until 22). "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Therefore, we can safely say that for every range there are 10 - (n +1) or 9 - n numbers whose tens number is lower than their units. 
Compute for the summation and you get 36."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"OR"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Since we are terribly sure that there is an arithmetic pattern for the count of disqualified numbers (the numbers whose tens digits are greater/equal to their units) per range, then we can just use the arithmetic series to compute for the total count of these numbers and subtract it from the total count of 2-digit numbers."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Hence,
10n - {(n/2)[(2(total count of disqualified numbers from 10 to 19)) + n-1]}"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"= 10(9) - {(9/2)[(2(2)) + 9-1]}"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"= 10(9) - ((9 x 12)/2)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"= 90 - 54"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"= 36"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The two digit numbers are :"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"10, 11, 12, 13, ............ , 97, 98, 99"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The required numbers are :"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(12, 13. ......., 19), (23, 24, ......., 29), (34, 35, 36, ......39), ...., (78, 79), (89)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"8 + 7 + 6 + ....... + 3 + 2 + 1 = (8/2)(8 + 1) = 36"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

comments.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Yes, that's one approach. There is another way, by counting those numbers in which the tens digit > ones digit, tens digit = ones digit, tens digit < ones digit.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

title: 10^100 is way too high
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Find the number of coprime pairs "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(a,b)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" of positive integers subject to  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"0< a<b<10^{100},"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" such that  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a\\mid (b^2-11)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b\\mid (a^2-11)."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"For people who don't know this, it's called "},{"type":"text","text":"Vieta Root Jumping/Root Flipping","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]},{"type":"text","text":". I learned it from the second worked example. Which is similar to this problem. (Actually, this problem is very familiar.)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"First note that if "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a\mid b^{2}-11"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b\mid a^{2}-11"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"ab\mid a^{2}+b^{2}-11"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Then let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{a^2+b^2-11}{ab}=k"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", for some positive integer "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"k"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\implies a^2+b^2-11=kab \\ \implies b^2-kab+(a^2-11)=0"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is a root of the equation "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x^2-kax+(a^2-11)=0."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"By Vieta's Formulas, the other root is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"r=(ka-b)=\dfrac{a^2-11}{b}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". We know that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"r"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" should be an integer since "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b+r=ka"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". In which "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"ka"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are integers. "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a^2-11>0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", we have "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a^2<ab"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" or "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a<b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 0<r<a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" which follows the conditions. So the solutions "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"r"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" here is the same as the solutions "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". In which they yield the same value of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"k"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Do what we did earlier again and again until we get a solution "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(m,n)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" such that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"m^2-11<0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", we have "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"m=1,2,3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Case 1: "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"m=1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We have "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n^2-kn=10"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" which yields to the solutions "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(n,k)=(2,-3),(5,3),(10,9)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". In which to the original equation, corresponds to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(a,b)=(1,2),(1,5),(1,10)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The pairs "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(1,5)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(1,10)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" have their own recursive sequence of pairs that will satisfy the equation. The pair "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(1,5)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" will give rise to the sequence "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(a_i,a_{i+1})"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" with "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a_0=1, a_1=5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", and the recursion "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a_{i+1}=3a_i-a_{i-1}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" for all "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"i\geq2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Similarly, the pair "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(1,10)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" will give rise to the sequence "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(b_i,b_{i+1})"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" with "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b_0=1, b_1=10"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", and the recursion "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b_{i+1}=9b_i-b_{i-1}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" for all "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"i\geq2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Case 2: "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"m=2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We have "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n(n-2k)=7"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" which will give rise to the solution "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(n,k)=(7,3)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". In which will correspond to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(a,b)=(2,7)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Similar to our first case, this pair will also give rise to a sequence "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(c_i,c_{i+1})"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" with "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"c_0=2, c_1=7"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and the recursion "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"c_{i+1}=3c_i-c_{i-1}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" for all "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"i\geq2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Case 3: "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"m=3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We have "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n(n-3k)=2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". But wait, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" should be greater than "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"m"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", a contradiction. So there are no solutions if "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"m=3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Solving this took me quite a long time. Plus it would be very long and it would be more understandable if you would refer to "},{"type":"text","text":"this","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]},{"type":"text","text":" instead."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Summing all solutions, we have "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1+238+238+105=\boxed{582}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"[Edit] Actually, I first typed in 582. And said I was wrong. So I tried a "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"+1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (in case I miscounted something) and got it right.  [Edit 2] Oops, so I was right after all"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"there are 101 people at a party you are playing a game were you have to spilt the group into 2 equal groups if you have to leave someone out how many people will be left out?"}]}]}

title: 101 Dalmations!

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The answer will be "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dbinom{15}{3}*\dbinom{12}{3}*\dbinom{9}{3}*\dbinom{6}{3}*\dbinom{3}{3} = 168168000"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".Hence the sum of the digits is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1+6+8+1+6+8 = \boxed{30}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\textbf{Note:}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" You should also have mentioned that the cages are distinct that is the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1st"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" dalmatians going to cage "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is different from them going to cage "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (say).Had all the cages been similar we would have to divide the whole thing by "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5!"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"When they stand in a row no. is 15!
Now permuting the 3 in each group is meaningless so we divide
by 3! * 3! * 3! * 3! * 3!=6^5.
My calculator did the rest."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: What is k=?k =? k=?

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Area of the large gray circle: "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"16^2\pi = 256 \pi"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Area of the small white  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" circles = "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5\times (16\pi)= 80\pi"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and area of one gray small circle is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"16\pi"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Area of medium white circle = "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"8^2\pi= 64\pi \implies"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Area of the gray shaded region = "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(256 - 80 - 64+ 16)\pi = 128\pi \implies k=\boxed{128}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}
